overview: This subject will enable students to develop their knowledge and skills in prosthodontics, including the diagnosis, treatment planning, rehabilitation, and maintenance of oral function. Students will engage in a variety of learning activities across multiple topics including the biology and pathology of dental tissues, radiography and radiology, occlusion, cast metal and porcelain restorations, fixed prosthodontics, partial removable prosthodontics, complete removable prosthodontics, implant-retained prostheses, and laboratory skills.
Learning activities will include seminars, pre-clinical activities and clinical patient care.

Students will engage in clinical activities in fixed, removable and implant prosthodontics with highly effective feedback from academics and specialists. Sessions are scheduled at Royal Dental Hospital of Melbourne and Melbourne Dental Clinic. The student will develop interdisciplinary links with other dental postgraduate programs to develop skills in intra- and interprofessional collaborative practice to provide comprehensive person-centred care.

assessments.description: Practical Assessment / Pre‐Clinical assessment prior to being allowed to start patient care. 1 hours. Hurdle requirement:. Must be passed

Case presentation and defence of known and
prepared clinical case. The emphasis is on case
management to date.. 1 hours
Topic based seminar presentation. The emphasis is on the understanding of the prepared topic. 1 hours

Case presentation and defence of known and
completed clinical case. 1 hours
Clinical Portfolio: Incorporates 542.5 hours of clinical practice during the year.. 15000 words (equivalent). Hurdle requirement:. Must satisfactorily meet the requirements of the clinical portfolio
Attendance requirement. Hurdle requirement:. Pass/Fail. 90% Attendance for all Seminars & Clinical Sessions

Prescribed texts: There are no specifically prescribed or recommended texts for this subject.
